newsitem.title: UK: European VGO heads to U.S., cargoes hit $165 fob N.
newsitem.headline: European VGO heads to U.S., cargoes hit $165 fob N.

text.p: European vacuum gas oil prices were firm on Friday, boosted by U.S. demand which has lifted prices over the past two weeks by some $8 a tonne.

A cargo sold early this week at $159.50 fob Scandinavia was re-sold later at $165 fob and is expected to head for the U.S. Demand from the U.S. Gulf was heard around four cents below the 70/30 NYMEX formula with offers at 3.50 under.
Dealers said cargoes were expected to move from Italy and possibly Spain to the U.S. over the next few days.
"The arb from the Med is still open. Any low sulphur material is snapped up pretty quickly," said a trader.
High sulphur VGO barges were pegged around $158 fob Rotterdam but activity was slow.
